Update Sept 19 2020 - Many of the issues mentioned in my original review(s) have been ironed out after patches and a couple of major updates. While it still has some issues here and there depending on what you're using it for, DeoVR is still my go to video app, and the one I'd recommend to anyone looking for a quality video playback app with some great options!  Upping review to 5 stars... pretty sure this started at 3/5 when I first posted the review a long while ago, so, great work devs! :)

one_reviews_text:
It works, but it's very obviously a launch-day product. Also, I think it's causing frequently blue-screens-of-death.

The UX needs refinement. The many features people are excited about are almost always buried several clicks away, e.g. the "Tilt" control that they show in their marketing materials is 2 clicks in and a razor-thin slider, and you can only fiddle with it while a giantic square menu is blotting out a big part of the video. Same with the controls for the app volume. To reset the VR centerpoint, you have to switch to the Oculus Desktop -- most VR games assign a hotkey to VR-reset because, when you need it, it's that important. Some of the clickables are very small. The timeline scrubber is only 4 or 5px tall, which sometimes means making more than one attempt to grab it. Most of the adjustments you can make are done via the same, very slender sliders, which can make things frustrating. None of those settings are quantified, so you have to eyeball them from video to video if adjustments are necessary.

The VCR controls exist, but could use refinement. The speed of fast-forward and fast-reverse seems to vary based on the length of the video. So, when watching something longer (20-30m), tapping fast-reverse takes you back 1 or 2 whole minutes, instead of e.g. 3 or 5 seconds, which is what things like Netflix and Amazon do with their video controls.

I can't tell if this app is actively maintained, or abandonware. Current version is 0.9x. But there's not a lot of competition out there, certainly not for $0.

I would like to see a v2.

And, as I mentioned, I think this app is causing frequent stop code 0x124 (a rare, special hardware error). I think this because I play lots of VR games with no such problem, and because in attempting to remedy the problem I've updated drivers and firmware for every chipset and every piece of hardware in my PC, and only DeoVR causes the BSOD. It happens unpredictably, but certainly more than once every 10 minutes of watching.
